governorates.name: Cairo
governorates.shortInfo: The capital of Egypt.
governorates.description: Cairo is Egypt's largest city, cultural and political center on the Nile, with a mix of modern life and ancient history.
hangouts: Cafes in Downtown and Garden City

governorates.name: Giza
governorates.shortInfo: Home of the Great Pyramids.
governorates.description: Giza governorate includes the Giza Plateau with the Great Pyramids and the Sphinx, modern suburbs and important museums.
attractions: Giza Plateau (Pyramids of Khufu, Khafre, Menkaure)
Saqqara and Step Pyramid of Djoser

governorates.name: Alexandria
governorates.shortInfo: Coastal city on the Mediterranean.
governorates.description: Alexandria is a historic Mediterranean port city founded by Alexander the Great, mixing ancient sites and seaside culture.

governorates.name: Dakahlia
governorates.shortInfo: Fertile Nile Delta governorate with Mansoura as a major city.
governorates.description: Dakahlia is in the Nile Delta; Mansoura is the administrative capital with universities, markets and Nile-side life.
attractions: Traditional Delta villages and agricultural scenery

governorates.name: Sharqia
governorates.shortInfo: Large Nile Delta governorate east of Cairo.
governorates.description: Sharqia (Ash Sharqiyah) is known for agricultural production, historic towns and close ties to Cairo and the Delta.
attractions: Historic towns such as Zagazig (local museums)

governorates.name: Gharbia
governorates.shortInfo: Delta governorate with Tanta as a cultural hub.
governorates.description: Gharbia is centrally located in the Nile Delta; Tanta hosts important festivals and has a busy commercial life.
attractions: Tanta's Sanabil and local historical mosques

governorates.name: Beheira
governorates.shortInfo: Northwest Nile Delta governorate with coastal parts.
governorates.description: Beheira includes agricultural lands and coastal areas near Alexandria and the Nile Delta waterways.
attractions: Coastal wetlands and small coastal towns

governorates.name: Qalyubia
governorates.shortInfo: Industrial and suburban governorate near Cairo.
governorates.description: Qalyubia (Kalyubiya) lies on the Nile's eastern bank near Cairo, with many industrial towns and suburban communities.

governorates.name: Kafr El Sheikh
governorates.shortInfo: Delta governorate known for rice and fisheries.
governorates.description: Kafr El Sheikh is a productive agricultural region in the Nile Delta with coastal lagoons and rural tourism potential.
hangouts: Kafr El Sheikh city waterfront cafes

governorates.name: Monufia
governorates.shortInfo: Small, densely populated Delta governorate.
governorates.description: Monufia (Menoufia) contains productive agricultural lands and important small cities with university presence.
attractions: Local museums and historic religious sites
hangouts: Shibin El Kom cafes and parks

governorates.name: Damietta
governorates.shortInfo: Port city and governorate on the Mediterranean and at the Nile outlet.
governorates.description: Damietta is known for its port, furniture industry, fresh seafood and coastal tourism.

governorates.name: Port Said
governorates.shortInfo: Port city at the northern entrance of the Suez Canal.
governorates.description: Port Said overlooks the Mediterranean and marks the mouth of the Suez Canal; it has a distinctive cosmopolitan harbour culture.
attractions: Historic colonial-era architecture on the corniche

governorates.name: Suez
governorates.shortInfo: City at the southern entrance of the Suez Canal.
governorates.description: Suez governorate occupies the southern entrance to the Suez Canal; key for shipping and industrial activity.

governorates.name: Ismailia
governorates.shortInfo: Canal city mid-way along the Suez Canal.
governorates.description: Ismailia is known for its green canalside parks, French-colonial heritage and role in Suez Canal history.

governorates.name: Red Sea
governorates.shortInfo: Coastal governorate famous for Red Sea resorts (Hurghada).
governorates.description: Red Sea governorate stretches along Egypt's east coast and includes world-class diving, beaches and desert tourism.
attractions: Marsa Alam diving and marine parks

governorates.name: Matrouh
governorates.shortInfo: Northwest coastal governorate with Mediterranean beaches.
governorates.description: Matrouh governorate includes Mersa Matruh, popular for white-sand beaches, Roman and Pharaonic sites, and desert oases.
attractions: Siwa Oasis (in the western desert region)

governorates.name: Aswan
governorates.shortInfo: Southern Nile governorate known for Nubian culture.
governorates.description: Aswan is famous for its Nile islands, Nubian villages, the High Dam and Philae Temple â€” a relaxed southern city.

governorates.name: Luxor
governorates.shortInfo: Open-air museum of ancient Egypt.
governorates.description: Luxor contains major ancient sites on both banks of the Nile, including Karnak, Luxor Temple and the Valley of the Kings.

governorates.name: Qena
governorates.shortInfo: Upper Egypt governorate near Luxor.
governorates.description: Qena is an Upper Egyptian governorate featuring access to ancient temples and agricultural communities along the Nile.
hangouts: Qena city cafes and riverside areas

governorates.name: Minya
governorates.shortInfo: Upper Egyptian governorate with important archaeological sites.
governorates.description: Minya and its governorate have Pharaonic and Greco-Roman remains, fertile Nile agriculture and strong local traditions.

governorates.name: Beni Suef
governorates.shortInfo: Nile governorate south of Cairo.
governorates.description: Beni Suef sits on the Nile with strong agricultural activity and local historical sites.

governorates.name: Faiyum
governorates.shortInfo: Oasis-like governorate with lakes and ancient sites.
governorates.description: Faiyum (Al Fayyum) is known for Lake Qarun, fertile wetlands, waterfalls at Wadi El Rayan and archaeological sites.
attractions: Wadi El Rayan waterfalls and lakes
Ancient ruins and local pottery crafts
hangouts: Eco-tourism sites around Wadi El Rayan

governorates.name: Assiut
governorates.shortInfo: Major Upper Egyptian city and governorate.
governorates.description: Assiut is a historic Upper Egyptian center with nearby Pharaonic tombs and a strong local culture.

governorates.name: Sohag
governorates.shortInfo: Upper Egypt governorate with archaeological importance.
governorates.description: Sohag contains ancient tombs, local monasteries and active agricultural communities along the Nile.

governorates.name: New Valley (Al Wadi Al Gedid)
governorates.shortInfo: Vast desert governorate with oases.
governorates.description: The New Valley governorate includes the Kharga Oasis and other desert oases, offering archeological sites and desert landscapes.

governorates.name: North Sinai
governorates.shortInfo: Sinai governorate on the Mediterranean and Gulf approaches.
governorates.description: North Sinai includes the coastal city of Al-Arish and has Mediterranean coastline, Bedouin cultural areas and border importance.

governorates.name: South Sinai
governorates.shortInfo: Sinai governorate famous for Sharm El-Sheikh and St. Catherine.
governorates.description: South Sinai is notable for Sharm El-Sheikh resorts, Ras Mohammed National Park and Mount Sinai (Jebel Musa).
attractions: Saint Catherine's Monastery and Mount Sinai
